JUDGES: András Baka;Françoise Tulkens;Mindia Ugrekhelidze;Riza Türmen;Vladimiro Zagrebelsky
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in LOC . At the time of the events he was employed by GPE and GPE
CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant was injured in an occupational accident and lost the third and fourth fingers of his left hand .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed an action for compensation before ORG of First Instance against GPE , ORG and CARDINAL other individuals who were allegedly responsible for the accident .
CARDINAL . On DATE , an expert report assessing the extent of the damage suffered by the applicant was submitted to the court .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged another case with the same court , claiming further damages . These CARDINAL procedures were later joined .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of First Instance decided that it did not have jurisdiction to examine the applicant 's case .
CARDINAL . On DATE the defendants appealed against this decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the decision .
CARDINAL . NORP On DATE the case was resumed before ORG .
CARDINAL . The first hearing was held on DATE . The court requested a report regarding the applicant 's disability .
CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE , the court postponed the scheduled hearings as the report requested on DATE had not yet been submitted .

CARDINAL . On DATE the report was submitted to the court . At the same hearing the court requested all the medical reports regarding the applicant . Furthermore , it requested that the applicant be re - examined by ORG .
CARDINAL . The court held QUANTITY hearings after DATE , the last of which was on DATE .
CARDINAL . According to the information in the case file , as submitted by the parties , the proceedings are apparently still pending before ORG .
